description: Retention of two single storey buildings for use storage and distribution (Use Class B8) (Retrospective Application)
decision_conditions: The modifications requiring the use of these two building to be storage/warehousing units (B8 use class) in order to maintain the integrity and functioning of the land for industrial purposes, shall be completed within six (6) months of the date of this permission.
Reason: In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended).

| The development hereby approved shall be retained in accordance with the following drawing(s) and document (s): MS/DV/UNIT25/2018 Rev A, MS/DV/UNIT25/2018-02 Rev A MS/DV/UNIT23/2018-02 Rev A, MS/DV/UNIT23/2018 Rev A.
Reason: For the avoidance of doubt, and in the interests of proper planning.

| Notwithstanding the provisions of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) Order 2015 (or any order revoking and re-enacting that order with or without modification), no development as specified in Schedule 2 Part 3 Classes I, T and V and Part 4 Classes B and C other than expressly authorised by this permission, shall be carried out without express planning permission first being obtained from the Local Planning Authority.

The premises shall be used for B8 Uses, and for no other purpose (including any other purpose in any Class of any Schedule to the Town and Country Planning (Use Classes) Order 1987, or in any provision equivalent to that Class in any statutory instrument revoking and re-enacting that Order with or without modification).

Reason: In order to restrict the use of the premises in the interest of the strategic function of this designated Strategic Industrial Land for small and medium businesses and of the amenities of future occupiers of any sensitive use (residential, day care, schools, hospital, care home etc.), and to ensure that the development accords with Policies 4A and 7A of the Adopted Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policies 2.17, 4.4, 7.14 and 7.15 of The London Plan (2016 As Amended) and guidance within the National Planning Policy Framework (2019).

| Refuse storage shall be provided on site in accordance with the standards adopted by the Local Planning Authority. Such provision shall be brought into use prior to the commencement of the development and retained permanently.

Reason:  To protect amenity of the area and in the interests of the future occupants of the development in accordance with policies with policies 7A and 7B of the Ealing Development Management Plan 2013, policy 1.1(e) of the Adopted Ealing Development (Core) Strategy and The London Plan (2016) policy 5.16.
